page.title: 17November the Fifth
page.content: On Guy Fawkes' Night, there are lots of firework parties in Exmouth. Some families have there own celebrations; others go to big displays. There used to be a huge party held at{Stoke Lyne {Hospital}in Brixington but last year (1984) it was moved to the{town {football ground}on{Southern Road.}It was a great night out but cost quite a bit to go in. You could buy sparklers but they were expensive. There was a big bonfire in the middle of the field and if you made a Guy, a man would take it from you and put it on top of the fire! The football pitch is outdoors, but you never get cold because the heat from the fire and the barbecue keeps you warm. There was food and drink on sale and some competitions for children. All the money raised went to Exmouth charities.
